title: Repeat Performance
creator_credit: Aubrey Schenck Productions, Bryan Foy Productions, Aubrey Schenck, Alfred L. Werker and Walter Bullock
brief_description: On New Year’s Eve 1946, Broadway actress Sheila Page apparently callously shoots dead her husband Barney. As she leaves the crime scene, she wishes she could play the year over with a different script. - Wikipedia

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

creator_credit_for_label: Aubrey Schenck Productions, Bryan Foy Productions, Aubrey Schenck, Alfred L. Werker and Walter Bullock
description: Broadway star, Sheila Page, shoots Barney, her murderous husband on New Year’s Eve. She flees her apartment and goes to her producer, John Friday. When she arrives, it is New Year’s day, a year earlier. She has been given the chance to live life over and correct the errors of the past only to find that the end will be the same although the path will be different.
description_for_label: Broadway star, Sheila Page, shoots Barney, her murderous husband on New Year’s Eve. She flees her apartment and goes to her producer, John Friday.
